{"step_by_step_thinking": "The study is retrospective and relies on the mothers' memory of their folic acid supplementation during pregnancy. This could lead to recall bias, as mothers with children diagnosed with ASD might remember their prenatal behaviors differently than mothers with healthy children. Interviewer bias is less likely as the questionnaires were standardized. Latency period and survival bias are not relevant in this context as they refer to the time between exposure and disease manifestation and the survival rate of participants, respectively.", "answer_choice": "C"}
